contact_name: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union
description: This index is based on 16 indicators from eight contributors in five areas: eco-innovation inputs, eco-innovation activities, eco-innovation outputs, environmental outcomes and socio-economic outcomes. The overall score of an EU Member State is calculated by the unweighted mean of the 16 sub-indicators. It shows how well individual Member States perform in eco-innovation compared to the EU average, which is equated with 100. For 2010-2012, the average used for indexing to 100 is the average of 27 EU Member States. From 2013 onwards, the average used is calculated from the data for 28 EU Member States. The relevant target in the Roadmap is for an increase in the funding for research that contributes to the environmental knowledge base. Such increases will improve a Member State’s positioning according to the index. Although the index is published annually, its subindicators are often not, so the index is a collation of the most recent data available each year. As its units are relative it can not indicate progress in absolute terms. For a detailed description of the indicators included in the Eco-Innovation Scoreboard and the calculation details, visit:
title: Eco-innovation index
name: PH2QN1G4sav5vgkkOXiJVw
contact_address: Joseph Bech building, 5 Rue Alphonse Weicker, L-2721 Luxembourg

<rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:ecodp="http://open-data.europa.eu/ontologies/ec-odp#" xmlns:foaf="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/" xmlns:dct="http://purl.org/dc/terms/" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:dcat="http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#">
  <dcat:Dataset rdf:about="http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/products-datasets/-/t2020_rt200">
    <dct:title xml:lang="en">Eco-innovation index</dct:title>
    <dct:title xml:lang="fr">L'indice de l'éco-innovation</dct:title>
    <dct:title xml:lang="de">Umwelt-Innovationsindex</dct:title>
    <dct:identifier>t2020_rt200</dct:identifier>
    <dct:description xml:lang="en">This index is based on 16 indicators from eight contributors in five areas: eco-innovation inputs, eco-innovation activities, eco-innovation outputs, environmental outcomes and socio-economic outcomes. The overall score of an EU Member State is calculated by the unweighted mean of the 16 sub-indicators. It shows how well individual Member States perform in eco-innovation compared to the EU average, which is equated with 100. For 2010-2012, the average used for indexing to 100 is the average of 27 EU Member States. From 2013 onwards, the average used is calculated from the data for 28 EU Member States. The relevant target in the Roadmap is for an increase in the funding for research that contributes to the environmental knowledge base. Such increases will improve a Member State’s positioning according to the index. Although the index is published annually, its subindicators are often not, so the index is a collation of the most recent data available each year. As its units are relative it can not indicate progress in absolute terms. For a detailed description of the indicators included in the Eco-Innovation Scoreboard and the calculation details, visit:</dct:description>
    <dct:description xml:lang="fr">not available yet</dct:description>
    <dct:description xml:lang="de">Der Index basiert auf 16 Indikatoren zusammengesetzt aus fünf Bereichen: Öko-Innovation Inputs, Outputs und Tätigkeiten, sowie ökologische und sozioökonomischen Ergebnisse. Die Gesamtpunktzahl von einem Mitgliedstaat der EU wird durch einen nicht gewichteten Mittelwert aus 16 Unterpositionen ermittelt. Die Zahl soll hinweisen, wie weit die einzelnen Mitgliedstaaten im Vergleich zum EU-Durchschnitt im Bereich Öko-Innovation sind; der Durchschntt entspricht 100. Für den Zeitraum 2010-2012 wird der Durchschnitt von 27 Mitgliedstaaten für die Indexierung verwendet, ab 2013 aus 28 Mitgliedstaaten errechnet. Das Ziel im Rahmen des Fahrplans ist eine Aufstockung der Forschungsmittel und damit eine Verbesserung der umweltpolitischen Wissensgrundlage. Dies verbessert die Stellung eines Mitgliedstaats nach dem Index. Der Index wird jährlich ermittelt, die darunter liegenden Subindikatoren jedoch nicht unbedingt, so dass der Index eine Zusammenstellung der jeweils verfügbaren jüngsten Daten darstellt. Da die Anteile relativ sind, ist es kein Indikator in absoluten Zahlen. Eine detaillierte Beschreibung der Indikatoren im Anzeiger für Öko-Innovationen und die Einzelheiten der Berechnung finden Sie hier:</dct:description>
